Speaker: ronson
Dialogue: Tell you what - we'll make a deal. I'll tell you what I know, then you tell me what you know.  O.K.?

Speaker: ronson
Dialogue: You're in the Malahide Institute. It's a psychiatric hospital. But, hey, don't feel judged - it was just the nearest place to bring you. Remember? You and your boyfriend... ?

Speaker: ronson
Dialogue: Don't worry. He's O.K.  We sent him home hours ago.  Jeez, what a story.

Speaker: ronson
Dialogue: What was it, kid? Smack? Angel dust? Don't tell me acid's back in fashion?

Speaker: kirsty
Dialogue: What are you talking about?  Who are you?

Speaker: ronson
Dialogue: Ronson.  Homicide.  I'm this district's slash and dash expert. Made a career of the nasty ones. That's why I was at your Dad's house.  Jesus, what a mess.

Speaker: ronson
Dialogue: We got two missing people and a house full of corpses.

Speaker: kirsty
Dialogue: I thought Steve had talked to you?

Speaker: ronson
Dialogue: Oh, pardon me. I obviously didn't convey my hesitation to take his story at face-value. No, YOU talk to me. But - do me a favor? - none of this DEMONS crap.

Speaker: kirsty
Dialogue: It's true. All of it. It's all true.

Speaker: kucich
Dialogue: Kucich here,sir.  We just found another one, though it suffered a little...

Speaker: kucich
Dialogue: ...er, accidental damage in discovery. Anyway, just about the only portable evidence we've got here - apart from human remains - is the mattress. Looks like someone was messed up real bad on it.

Speaker: ronson
Dialogue: What the hell are you asking me for?  Tag it.  Move it.

Speaker: malahide
Dialogue: We can bring them back properly more often than scientific orthodoxy dictates, ladies and gentlemen.  And the knife, far from the enemy of of analysis, is often its greatest ally in solving the puzzles of psychosis. Analysis isolates and massages. Surgery pinpoints and corrects. ... though you've got to know what you're doing, of course...

Speaker: malahide
Dialogue: Some things are obvious. Here, for example, ...

Speaker: malahide
Dialogue: ...are the optical motor nerve control centers.

Speaker: malahide
Dialogue: Now. This case. A deeply-buried psychosis severe enough to produce frighteningly frequent hysteria and aggression. Incurable. Say others. Not so. Analysis isolates. The knife exposes. Medication controls.

Speaker: malahide
Dialogue: And then, ladies and gentlemen, we REBUILD. With all the care and knowledge that our years of training have given us ...

Speaker: intercom
Dialogue: Dr. Malahide, the new arrival is awake, and appears very distressed.

Speaker: malahide
Dialogue: My part in this is over.  You may tidy up for me.  Kyle, you come with me.

Speaker: ronson
Dialogue: Easy, easy.  Whatever happened, whatever you saw, it's not here now.

Speaker: kirsty
Dialogue: I saw it...him.  But I got away. And I took the box.  And I solved it.  And they came.

Speaker: malahide
Dialogue: Sorry.  Must get that door fixed.  Detective Ronson?

Speaker: malahide
Dialogue: My assistant, Kyle Macrae.  And this must be Kirsty?

Speaker: malahide
Dialogue: I've read the boy's statement. Quite the adventure they believe they had. I'd like to talk to her alone. Do you think ... ?

Speaker: ronson
Dialogue: Mmmm.  O.K.  Frankly, I think she's more your territory than mine.  Shame.

Speaker: ronson
Dialogue: Kirsty.  Doctor Malahide's going to look after you now.  Maybe we could talk some more tomorrow.

Speaker: kirsty
Dialogue: Wait!  The mattress.  You've got to destroy it.  She DIED on it, you see.  The mattress.  It's haunted now.  She can come back... like Frank. SHE CAN COME BACK.

Speaker: malahide
Dialogue: Detective. I'll be able to help this girl. But I need your assistance ...

Speaker: kyle
Dialogue: Nearly a doctor. I'm Kyle Macrae. Call me Kyle.

Speaker: kirsty
Dialogue: The cop. He didn't believe me.

Speaker: malahide
Dialogue: I suspect not. But that doesn't necessarily mean you're wrong, does it?

Speaker: malahide
Dialogue: Well, I don't know yet. However, you're not lying. YOU believe this is the truth.

Speaker: intern
Dialogue: Sorry, Dr. Malahide. But it's Tiffany. She's escaped ... again.

Speaker: kirsty
Dialogue: I'm sorry, Kirsty. Kyle will come back with something to help you sleep. We shall speak tomorrow.

Speaker: kyle
Dialogue: Oh, Jesus, I'm sorry. God, if anyone should know not to do that, it's me. I'm sorry. O.K.?

Speaker: kyle
Dialogue: Sad, huh? She's been here six months. Her name's TIFFANY.

Speaker: kyle
Dialogue: Almost complete withdrawal. She hasn't said a word for nearly two years.

Speaker: kyle
Dialogue: Yeah. Doctor Malahide's got her doing these jig-saws and things, though. Says it's helping to bring her out.

Speaker: kyle
Dialogue: Anyway, let's concentrate on you for a moment. Wanna suck on this for me?

Speaker: kirsty
Dialogue: Hey, good joke, Kyle. Do you always come on to the mentally ill?

Speaker: kyle
Dialogue: Shit. Sorry. Here's the pills. Red face. Door. Bye.

Speaker: kirsty
Dialogue: Jesus, I'm glad I'm not paying for this place.

Speaker: malahide
Dialogue: And how are we feeling today...?

Speaker: browning
Dialogue: Get them off me. Get them off me.

Speaker: kirsty
Dialogue: Oh, Jesus. I can't explain. It's ...it's. I don't know how to help! I have to save him and I don't know how to help!

Speaker: kyle
Dialogue: Kirsty, I'm sorry...  don't understand. I...

Speaker: kirsty
Dialogue: I know. No-one can. But I have to save him. Where's the other doctor? He said He'd listen. He promised.

Speaker: kyle
Dialogue: Dr. Malahide. Yes. Look, I'll fetch him. You take it easy. I'm sure he can help.

Speaker: kirsty
Dialogue: Help. No, no-one can help. I just want someone to listen or I WILL go crazy.

Speaker: kyle
Dialogue: If anyone can help, HE can.

Speaker: kirsty
Dialogue: Yeah? He got a ticket to Hell?

Speaker: malahide
Dialogue: Officer Kucich? Yes, Doctor Malahide. You've spoken to Ronson? Yes ... That's right. The mattress ... No, I'll meet you by the side entrance. No, no, my HOUSE. Yes, let me make that clear. The house, NOT the hospital. ... Yes ... Fine, and thank you.

Speaker: kirsty
Dialogue: It must have been going on forever...

Speaker: kirsty
Dialogue: But the part I know about, That must have started with my Uncle Frank...

Speaker: malahide
Dialogue: Then let us speak of it ...

Speaker: browning
Dialogue: Get them off me. Get. Them. Off. Me.

Speaker: julia
Dialogue: Don't be embarrassed. You're my friend.

Speaker: kirsty
Dialogue: Shit, Kyle. This is getting to be a habit. What is it, some kind of shock-therapy?

Speaker: julia
Dialogue: Now all we need is a skin.

Speaker: kirsty
Dialogue: As much as that bed of nails allowed.

Speaker: kyle
Dialogue: Well, the sofa isn't often used for sleeping on...

Speaker: kirsty
Dialogue: Oh yeah? On your own a lot, Huh?

Speaker: kyle
Dialogue: I think I need to talk. About what I saw.

Speaker: kirsty
Dialogue: You thought I was crazy, didn't you?

Speaker: kyle
Dialogue: Jesus, yes! What do you expect. I mean, God, I still do! It's just that now I'm crazy too.

Speaker: kirsty
Dialogue: And you're sure it was a woman?

Speaker: kyle
Dialogue: God, I wish I could say no. This is going to do terrible things to my attitude, you know.

Speaker: kirsty
Dialogue: Don't worry about it. Your attitude sucks anyway.

Speaker: kyle
Dialogue: Hey, so for it. Don't let pity stop you. I'm down. Nail me.

Speaker: kirsty
Dialogue: What can I do? How can I save him?

Speaker: kirsty
Dialogue: The box. I need the box.

Speaker: kyle
Dialogue: The box? Like in your story? Like in his house?

Speaker: kyle
Dialogue: The Boxes. In the House. I told you.

Speaker: kirsty
Dialogue: You DIDN'T tell me. Do you mean Malahide's got...

Speaker: kyle
Dialogue: Yeah. The things you were talking about.

Speaker: kyle
Dialogue: Wait a minute. What do you mean, 'I'm going?' TO the HOUSE?

Speaker: kirsty
Dialogue: I don't know, Kyle. You're the fucking expert. Now get out of the way!

Speaker: kirsty
Dialogue: Because I'm going to get my father!

Speaker: kirsty
Dialogue: I'm going to get my father.

Speaker: kyle
Dialogue: Two seconds. Just two seconds. Don't move.

Speaker: kyle
Dialogue: I KNOW I don't have to. It's just my time of the month to be a complete fucking idiot. O.K.?

Speaker: kyle
Dialogue: Wait! The .. thing ... I want to be sure it's not here.

Speaker: julia
Dialogue: Sssh. I think it's still here.

Speaker: julia
Dialogue: Yes. I had to stop you going in there because I knew you'd cry out. Any normal person would. It ...It's just TERRIBLE.

Speaker: julia
Dialogue: Was I right? Is it terrible?

Speaker: julia
Dialogue: Oh. You look awful.  You poor boy. Come here...

Speaker: julia
Dialogue: Kirsty! How nice of you to drop in.

Speaker: julia
Dialogue: You have surprisingly good taste in men.

Speaker: kirsty
Dialogue: Kyle! No! I'll kill you, you...

Speaker: julia
Dialogue: Oh, you can try it, you little bitch. I'd love you to try it. But I'm not just the woman I was.

Speaker: kirsty
Dialogue: What, you mean you're something more than a whore with a vicious streak?

Speaker: julia
Dialogue: I mean I'm something more than human, you little shit!

Speaker: julia
Dialogue: Oh, Kirsty. They didn't tell you, did they? I'm afraid they've changed the rules of the fairy tale; I'm no longer just the wicked step-mother.

Speaker: julia
Dialogue: So come on; Take your best shot, Snow White.

Speaker: julia
Dialogue: You're sure this is what you want?

Speaker: malahide
Dialogue: It's what I've ALWAYS wanted. A view of ... beyond.

Speaker: malahide
Dialogue: You were almost enough, Julia but...I have to see. I have to KNOW.

Speaker: pinhead
Dialogue: It is not HANDS that call us...

Speaker: kirsty
Dialogue: Hey, remember me? From the hospital? I was in the next room?

Speaker: kirsty
Dialogue: You don't want to go down there. You REALLY don't want to go down there.

Speaker: kirsty
Dialogue: Tiffany! Don't trust it! Don't Trust it!

Speaker: pinhead
Dialogue: Ah, Kirsty. And we thought we'd lost you.

Speaker: female cenobite
Dialogue: So sweet of you to come back.

Speaker: pinhead
Dialogue: How can it send us back, child? We're already here. And so are you.

Speaker: kirsty
Dialogue: No! You... You can't! It wasn't me...I didn't do it! I didn't open the box!

Speaker: female cenobite
Dialogue: Didn't open the box. And what was it last time? Didn't know what the box was. And yet we DO keep finding each other, don't we?

Speaker: pinhead
Dialogue: Oh, Kirsty; so eager to play, so reluctant to admit it.

Speaker: female cenobite
Dialogue: Perhaps you're teasing us. Are you teasing us?

Speaker: kirsty
Dialogue: But I didn't open it! I didn't!

Speaker: pinhead
Dialogue: But he's in his own Hell, child And quite unreachable.

Speaker: pinhead
Dialogue: But it's true, He is his own Hell. Just as you are in yours.

Speaker: pinhead
Dialogue: But, please; feel free. Explore. We'll always be here...

Speaker: pinhead
Dialogue: ... we have Eternity to know your flesh!

Speaker: julia
Dialogue: Come. I have such sights to show you.

Speaker: kirsty
Dialogue: Do you see? You were RIGHT. This IS a puzzle, too. But WE'RE CAUGHT in the puzzle.

Speaker: malahide
Dialogue: Enough. God, that's enough. We HAVE to go back.

Speaker: julia
Dialogue: Go back? What an earth makes you think we can go back?

Speaker: julia
Dialogue: Sorry, friend. No day trips to Hell. Here you are. Here you stay. And forward the only way to go.

Speaker: kirsty
Dialogue: Tiffany. Wait here. If I'm not back real soon - get out. Get home.

Speaker: voice
Dialogue: No. Over here. Behind the screen.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: That's it, baby. Come to Daddy.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: What's the matter, Kirsty? It's only Frank. It's only Uncle Frank.

Speaker: kirsty
Dialogue: I should have known! I should've known he wouldn't be here! This place is only for filth like you!

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: Oh, right. Daddy's died and gone to heaven, eh?

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: See? He's here. You should learn to believe your Uncle Frank.

Speaker: kirsty
Dialogue: No! He SHOULDN'T be here! It SHOULD'VE been a trick!

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: 'Fraid not, baby. He belongs here. With me. We're the same. Brothers. Equal and opposite. Pure appetite. Pure banality. Too much feeling. None at all.

Speaker: kirsty
Dialogue: You're full of shit, Frank Cotton. My Dad wasn't like that at all. He could feel. He could love. He loved ME.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: Don't waste your tears. Look at him!

Speaker: kirsty
Dialogue: He loved me, you bastard! He Loved me, he loved my mother. He even loved that bitch you betrayed him with!

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: Ah, Julia. She hasn't been to see me recently. That's why it's so nice to have you here, baby. Daddy's little girl. So pretty when she's upset. Come to Daddy,

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: Now don't be naughty, Kirsty. Or I'll have to punish you first. Perhaps you'd like that. Would you like that?

Speaker: kirsty
Dialogue: Daddy! Daddy! I love you! Help me!

Speaker: larry
Dialogue: Get your fucking hands off my daughter, you bastard!

Speaker: julia
Dialogue: But you WANTED this. You wanted to SEE. You wanted to KNOW. And here it is. The heart of Hell. Leviathan.

Speaker: julia
Dialogue: Why do you think I was allowed to go back? For YOU? No, it wanted souls. And I brought you. And you wanted to KNOW. Now you're both happy.

Speaker: larry
Dialogue: Stay there, baby. Don't come in.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: Yes. Stay there. I'll be with you in a minute.

Speaker: julia
Dialogue: Well, well. All my family together again. How very sweet.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: Yes. You're a girl who remembers her promises.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: And I know how much I mean to you. Come here.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: Come here. Kiss me. And then...

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: ... we'll have a real family re-union.

Speaker: larry
Dialogue: Jesus Christ, FRANK. I don't believe you. You don't know her at all do you? You still think you're in charge.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: Of course I am. She BELONGS to me.

Speaker: kirsty
Dialogue: For God's sake! He KILLED you!

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: She's forgiven me that. Haven't you?

Speaker: julia
Dialogue: Do you really need to ask?

Speaker: larry
Dialogue: Wait a minute.  Why are we following her? Who is this?

Speaker: kirsty
Dialogue: Tiffany, listen.  You've solved it. But we've got to solve it the OTHER way.  See?  See? We've got to get out.

Speaker: kirsty
Dialogue: Please!  Tiffany, Please! Get us out!  Take us home, please!

Speaker: malahide
Dialogue: Tiffany. Come. I have a whole new world of puzzles for you to enjoy ...

Speaker: malahide
Dialogue: A whole new world of pleasures for you to endure.

Speaker: larry
Dialogue: No.  I've had enough of this shit. Who the hell are you?

Speaker: larry
Dialogue: Fuck you and the horse you rode in on.

Speaker: larry
Dialogue: O.K.  You've done it before.  You can do it again.  GET US OUT OF HERE!

Speaker: kirsty
Dialogue: No. Come on. We have to get out of here.

Speaker: julia
Dialogue: Oh, poor Larry.  You never could hold on to anything for very long, could you?

Speaker: larry
Dialogue: Jesus. O.K. No more arguments. Just RUN!

Speaker: kirsty
Dialogue: These flowers. I saw them just...

Speaker: kirsty
Dialogue: What do you do? I just don't know what to do.

Speaker: intern
Dialogue: We just can't say. O.R.'s on standby. They'll do what they can.

Speaker: intern
Dialogue: Wait out here. A doctor will talk to you when we know more.

Speaker: kirsty
Dialogue: Is he going to be all right?

Speaker: kirsty
Dialogue: Oh, Jesus. I'm sorry. I'm sorry. I didn't mean it.

Speaker: kirsty
Dialogue: It's 0.K. They can't beat an elevator. Not upstairs. It'll be O.K.

Speaker: kirsty
Dialogue: Oh, Christ. This isn't just personal anymore.

Speaker: pinhead
Dialogue: Oh. No Boxes. Such a shame.

Speaker: female cenobite
Dialogue: No more delays, Kirsty. No more teasing. Time to play.

Speaker: pinhead
Dialogue: No more deals, Kirsty. It's your flesh we want to experience, not your skill at bargaining.

Speaker: kirsty
Dialogue: No deals! Just information. Information. Free of charge. No strings. Just information.

Speaker: pinhead
Dialogue: Go on. But trick us again, child, and your suffering will be legendary even in Hell.

Speaker: pinhead
Dialogue: What is this? Someone else you think escaped us, like Frank?

Speaker: kirsty
Dialogue: No, No, this one didn't escape. You told me you'd always been in Hell. You were wrong. Look at it. LOOK. IT'S YOU.

Speaker: kirsty
Dialogue: It's you! You HAVEN'T always been as you are. You were HUMAN. Remember. Remember all your confusions. Think!

Speaker: patient
Dialogue: So what, girls? It's O.K. for an ego-trip but it doesn't got the job done.

Speaker: tiffany
Dialogue: I have to go back. Or it'll never stop.

Speaker: kirsty
Dialogue: What are you doing? What are WE doing?

Speaker: tiffany
Dialogue: I can't do it here. I have to go to it.

Speaker: kirsty
Dialogue: No. Don't let it. You've come this far.

Speaker: malahide
Dialogue: Ah, girls. And how are we feeling today?

Speaker: malahide
Dialogue: You have your whole lives behind you now.

Speaker: malahide
Dialogue: Surgery is open, Tiffany. What was today's agenda?

Speaker: julia
Dialogue: I'm a girl who keeps her promises.

Speaker: kirsty
Dialogue: So. What're you going to do? Open up a games-shop somewhere? Sell jigsaw puzzles?

Speaker: workman
Dialogue: So whose was all this shit?
